meanings.definition: The action of recording or registering the time or speed of something.
meanings.sent1: I used clocking to track how fast the car was going.
meanings.sent2: The clocking of the runner's time was crucial for the race results.
meanings.sent3: The clocking of the turtle's speed was surprisingly fast!
meanings.sent4: Her precision in clocking the hours spent on each task was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The clocking of the train's arrival time was spot on.

meanings.definition: The act of hitting or striking something, especially with a fist.
meanings.sent1: He delivered a powerful clocking to the punching bag.
meanings.sent2: The boxer's coach emphasized the importance of proper clocking technique.
meanings.sent3: The clocking of the door echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent4: The clocking of the hammer against the nail was rhythmic.
meanings.sent5: The clocking of the gavel signaled the end of the court session.

meanings.definition: The process of adjusting or setting a clock or timer.
meanings.sent1: She carefully performed the clocking of the alarm for the morning.
meanings.sent2: The clocking of the grandfather clock was a daily ritual.
meanings.sent3: The clocking of the microwave was always a challenge for him.
meanings.sent4: His expertise in clocking all the devices in the house saved time.
meanings.sent5: The clocking of the digital watch was a simple task for her.
